benchmark_details.name: DEEP corpus
benchmark_details.overview: The DEEP corpus is designed for modeling the social display of the emotion shame, with annotations for different emotion regulation strategies classified during shame-inducing situations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To investigate how instruction-tuned large language models can classify emotion regulation strategies during shame-eliciting interactions.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Due to the complexity of annotations, the corpus is limited in size and variability, focusing specifically on shame regulation.

data.source: The DEEP corpus consisting of recordings from shame-eliciting job interviews.
data.annotation: Annotations conducted by three trained raters based on participant behavior, verbalized introspection, and context.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on model predictions compared to ground truth labels from the DEEP corpus.
methodology.interpretation: Accuracy rates indicate the percentage of correctly classified emotion regulation strategies among all predictions.
methodology.baseline_results: The compared models include Bayesian Networks and instruction-tuned Llama2-7B with reported accuracy of 0.84.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Limited to a small, culturally homogeneous group of participants.
harm: Potential exposure of participants to negative emotional states during data collection.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Informed consent obtained from participants with measures in place to protect sensitive data.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Received corpus upon request from the authors, ethical review board approved data collection.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Informed consent acquired prior to participation in the study.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Ethical approval for data processing outlined in the study.
